text: Now I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer
source: NBC Documentary reflection on Trinity Test

text: The atomic bomb made the prospect of future war unendurable. It has led us up those last few steps to the mountain pass; and beyond there is a different country.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

text: There are children playing in the streets who could solve some of my top problems in physics, because they have modes of sensory perception that I lost long ago.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

text: The scientist is not responsible for the laws of nature, but it is a scientist's job to find out how these laws operate.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

text: We knew the world would not be the same. A few people laughed, a few people cried. Most people were silent.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

text: In some sort of crude sense which no vulgarity, no humor, no overstatement can quite extinguish, the physicists have known sin; and this is a knowledge which they cannot lose.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer
source: Physics in the Contemporary World speech

text: Science is not everything, but science is very beautiful.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

text: The general notions about human understanding which are illustrated by discoveries in atomic physics are not in the nature of things wholly unfamiliar, wholly unheard of, or new.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer
